definition: to remarry (of widow)/to pass on (blame, cost, obligation, unpleasant consequence etc)/to transfer (blame, guilt)/to pass the buck
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)

sentences.english: It is to be assumed that the information was then passed on to the AQ Khan nuclear proliferation network.
sentences.chinese: 它是假定該資料，然後轉嫁到卡迪爾汗的核擴散網絡。

sentences.english: Thus, the US regularly transfer its own economic crisis onto others.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，美國不斷把自己的危機轉嫁於人。

sentences.english: The politician tried to impute some unfortunate remarks to his enemy.
sentences.chinese: 這個政治家想把一些不當的言論轉嫁到他的政敵身上。

sentences.english: Don't try to shift the losses on to the customers.
sentences.chinese: 不要企圖把損失轉嫁到顧客頭上。

definition: responsible for its profit and losses (of organization)/financially autonomous/personal financial responsibility
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
